main_definition: To make something possible or easier by providing the means, opportunity, or assistance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give power to someone or something
meanings_and_examples.example: By enabling the new software update, I can now access more advanced features.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To allow someone to do something they weren't previously able to
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher enabled her students to participate in a prestigious science competition by providing additional resources and support.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To make it possible for someone or something to function properly
meanings_and_examples.example: Regular maintenance can enable the car's engine to run smoothly over time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give authority, permission, or legal rights
meanings_and_examples.example: The company enabled its employees by granting them flexible work hours and remote working options.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To prepare something to make it available for use or consumption
meanings_and_examples.example: She enabled the cake layers before frosting and decorating them, allowing each layer to set properly.
